class.name: Wizard
class.shortfluff: You command eldritch forces to blast your enemies, bring them under your thumb, twist their senses and impede their movement.
class.fluff: An Arcanist is spellcaster who focuses on the tenets of a particular school of magic. This specialization makes each Arcanist distinctive. After all, a wizard who casts evocation presents a very different picture to the world from one who has mastered the art of illusion or enchantment.

While they are scholarly, don't expect to find Arcanists just hidden away in dusty towers. They hit the ground running, ready to explore every dungeon and ancient ruin in search of lore and knowledge that will increase their understanding on everything arcane - and thereby increase their personal power.

The ancient traditions of the schools of wizardry have been handed down since the first began to dabble in arcane magic. What started as techniques and methods of training between masters and apprentices eventually become more institutionalized, and eventually actual academies of arcane study sprang up in the world and even among the eladrin of the Feywild.

Today, where and how arcane magic is taught depends on where you happen to be. On the borderlands, in places such as Fallcrest, solitary mages pass on their knowledge to one or two apprenctives at a time. In larger settlements, such as the city of Nera, academies are dedicated to the training of wizards in all the schools of magic.

feature.name: Arcane Implement Mastery
feature.benefit: While able to wield different types of implements, all Arcanists will grow to favour one over the others.
You gain your choice of either Orb of Deception, Orb of Imposition, Staff of Defense, Tome of Binding, Tome of Readiness, or Wand of Accuracy.

subfeature.name: Orb of Deception
subfeature.benefit: In your hands, the orb gives a degree of reliability to illusions and enchantments.
You gain the orb of imposition power.

power.title: Orb of Imposition
power.fluff: You see a flaw in the reflection of your spell in your implement, and move to counter it

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding an orb implement

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You miss an enemy with a Wizard Illusion or Enchantment power

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature within 3 squares of the missed target that is not a target of the triggering attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You repeat the triggering attack against the target, with a bonus to the attack roll equal to your Charisma modifier.

subfeature.name: Orb of Imposition
subfeature.benefit: Your focus on your orb allows you to extend the effects of some of your spells.
You gain the orb of imposition power.

power.title: Orb of Imposition
power.fluff: You tether your spell to your implement, forcing it to last longer

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding an orb implement

section.name: Target:
section.text: One of your active effects

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can apply one of the following effects to the target:
► If the target lasts until a successful saving throw, the next saving throw against it takes a penalty equal to your Wisdom modifier.
► If the target is from a 1st-level at-will attack and would end at the end of your current turn, it instead ends at the end of your next turn.

subfeature.name: Staff of Defense
subfeature.benefit: You have weaved protective magic into your staff.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC, and gain the staff of defense power.

power.title: Staff of Defense
power.fluff: You release the abjurative power of your staff just as an attack is about to hit you

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a staff implement

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: An attack hits you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a bonus to all defenses against the triggering attack equal to your Constitution modifier.

subfeature.name: Tome of Binding
subfeature.benefit: Your tome contains extensive lore on summoning creatures, allowing you to empower them.
You gain the tome of binding power.

power.title: Tome of Binding
power.fluff: Flipping through your tome, you locate the information needed for a more deadly summon

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a tome implement

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You use an arcane Summoning power

section.name: Effect:
section.text: All creatures summoned by the triggering power gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier.

subfeature.name: Tome of Readiness
subfeature.benefit: You have a page of your tome bookmarked, to give you flexibility in casting spells.
When you prepare your Wizard powers from your spellbook, choose one encounter attack power of your level or lower as your tome spell.
You gain the tome of readiness power.

power.title: Tome of Readiness
power.fluff: You quickly open your tome to the right page to take advantage of a specialized spell

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a tome implement

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have at least one unexpended wizard encounter attack of your tome spell's level or higher

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You expend one wizard encounter attack of your tome spell's level or higher, and gain the use of your tome spell.
If you have not used your tome spell before the end of the encounter, it is automatically expended.

subfeature.name: Wand of Accuracy
subfeature.benefit: You have chosen to master the wand for its elegance and precision.
You gain the wand of accuracy power.

power.title: Wand of Accuracy
power.fluff: You use your wand to gain pinpoint accuracy with a spell

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be wielding a wand implement

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make an attack roll with an Arcane attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a bonus to the triggering attack roll equal to your Dexterity modifier.

feature.name: Cantrips
feature.benefit: Besides the more powerful spells at his or her command, an Arcanist also learns a collection of lesser applications of the arcane energies. These cantrips help the Arcanist in their daily activities.
You gain your choice of four of the following powers.

power.title: Chameleon's Mask
power.fluff: You pull strands of shadown, blending your colors and sounds with your surroundings to help you hide from your enemy's sight and hearing

section.name: Trigger:
section.text: You make a Stealth check

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You are considered trained in Stealth for the triggering check. If you are already trained in Stealth, you can instead roll twice and take the higher result.

power.title: Disrupt Undead
power.fluff: A simple gesture causes the darkness powering and protecting an undead creature to briefly unravel

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Ranged 7

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Ranged 10

section.name: Target:
section.text: One undead creature

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target's necrotic resistance, if any, is reduced by 5 until the end of your current turn.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Reduced by 10.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Reduced by 15.

power.title: Ghost Sound
power.fluff: With a wink, you create an illusory sound that emanates from a distant location

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Ranged 15

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Ranged 20

section.name: Target:
section.text: One object or unoccupied square

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You cause a sound as quiet as a whisper or as loud as a yelling or fighting creature to emanate from the target.

You can produce nonvocal sounds such as the ringing of a sword blow, jingling armor, or scraping stone. If you produce a whisper, you can make it quiet enough that only creatures adjacent to the target can hear the words.

power.title: Light
power.fluff: With a wave of your hand, you cause a bright light to appear on the tip of your staff, upon some other object, or in a nearby space

section.name: Target:
section.text: One object or unoccupied space

section.name: Effect:
section.text: The target sheds light until the end of the encounter or until you use this power again.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: The light lasts for 1 hour.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: The light lasts for 8 hours.
The light fills the target's space and all squares within 4 squares of it with bright light, and dim light for further 2 squares. You can put out the light as a free action.

power.title: Mage Hand
power.fluff: You gesture toward an object nearby, and a spectral floating hand lifts the object into the air and moves it where you wish

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Ranged 7

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Ranged 10

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You conjure a spectral, floating hand in an unoccupied square within range. The hand lasts until the end of your next turn or until you use this power again.

If you conjure the hand into a square adjacent to yourself and are holding an object when you use this power, the hand can move the object into a pack, a pouch, a sheath, or a similar container and simultaneously move any one object carried or worn anywhere on your body into your hand.
While the hand persists, you can take the following actions:

section.name: Minor Action:
section.text: The hand picks up or manipulates an object weighing 20 pounds or less. It can hold only one object at a time.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: 30 pounds or less.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: 40 pounds or less.

section.name: Move Action:
section.text: The hand moves up to 5 squares in any direction, carrying the object it holds.

section.name: Free Action:
section.text: The hand drops the object it is holding.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The hand persists until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Prestidigitation
power.fluff: You perform an amusing magical trick, such as creating a dancing wisp of light, freshening a wilting flower, making a coin invisible, or warming a cold drink

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You accomplish one of the following effects in range:
► Change the color of all items in 1 cubic foot until the stroke of midnight.
► Create a brief, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint music, or a strong odor.
► Clean or soil all items in 1 cubic foot.
► Instantly light (or snuff out) a candle, torch, or a small campfire.
► Chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
► Make a small mark or symbol appear on a surface for up to 1 hour.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Up to 4 hours.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Up to 8 hours.
► Produce out of nothingness a small item or image that exists until the end of your next turn.
► Make a small, handheld item invisible until the end of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Nothing you create with this cantrip can deal damage, serve as a weapon or tool, or hinder another creature's actions. This cantrip cannot duplicate the effect of any other power.
You can have up to two prestidigitation effects active at one time. When you use this power, you choose which previous effect ends if the use would exceed your limit.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Up to three effects.

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Up to four effects.

power.title: Spook
power.fluff: You gather shadows to yourself, so that when you speak, your words drip with menace

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You are considered trained in the next Intimidate check you make. If you are already trained in Intimidate, you can instead roll twice and take the higher result.
You must either make the check or start the action for making the check on this turn.

power.title: Suggestion
power.fluff: You weave arcane power through your words, infusing each phrase with persuasive magic

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You are considered trained in the next Diplomacy check you make. If you are already trained in Diplomacy, you can instead roll twice and take the higher result.
You must either make the check or start the action for making the check on this turn.

power.title: Water Stride
power.fluff: You stride across a liquid surface as if it were solid ground

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the end of your next turn, you can treat liquid surfaces as if they were solid ground but difficult terrain.

power.title: Whispering Wind
power.fluff: You speak a message to the wind and let it carry your words to an audience you choose

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You cause a breeze to carry a message of up to 25 words or a sound up to 6 seconds long to a place you choose. The destination must be within a number of miles equal to your Intelligence modifier and must be familiar to you, and it must be a location that the wind can reach.

Once you complete the message or sound, the wind travels at speed 5 (2 ½ miles per hour) until it reaches the destination, where it conveys the message or the sound, regardless of whether anyone hears it.

section.name: Level 11:
section.text: Within a number of miles equal to 2 + your Intelligence modifier, and speed 7 (3 ½ miles per hour).

section.name: Level 21:
section.text: Within a number of miles equal to 5 + your Intelligence modifier, and speed 10 (5 miles per hour).

section.name: Special:
section.text: You cannot regain the use of this power before the message has been delivered.

feature.name: School Specialization
feature.benefit: While they have access to the full gamut of wizardly spells, each Arcanist tends to focus on a subset of those spells. Over generations, these different focuses have been codified into groups, traditions, and others. Collectively they are called the schools of wizardry.
Choose Conjuration, Enchantment, Ethermancy, Evocation, Illusion, Necromancy, or Transmutation as your Arcanist's specialized school.

subfeature.name: Conjuration
subfeature.benefit: The art of conjuration is all about filling the field. An Arcanist specializing in this school brings forth new terrain, summons creatures to aid him or her, and and creates arcane entities for specialized purposes.

► You can use a standard action to sustain an arcane Conjuration or Zone you have created, even if the power could normally not be sustained. The Conjuration or Zone persists until the end of your next turn.
